name: Eyelash Fern
description: Actiniopteris australis, commonly known as Eyelash Fern, is a terrestrial fern native to tropical regions of Africa, Madagascar, and Asia. It belongs to the Pteridaceae family and features upright fronds (10-20 cm tall) with small, dramatic, fan-shaped, dark green fronds with distinctive eyelash-like segments. The plant displays an upright rosette growth habit. In its native habitat, it grows in rocky areas and on cliffs in tropical forests. In terrariums or indoor settings, this plant is perfect for small spaces and terrariums. It's popular among fern enthusiasts for its unique fan-shaped fronds.
careTips: Keep soil consistently moist but not waterlogged
Avoid direct sunlight - prefers bright indirect light
Brown edges indicate low humidity or underwatering
